phrase_cn: 道成了肉身，**住**在我们中间
phrase_en: And the Word became flesh and **dwelt** among us
sentence_context: And the Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we have seen his glory, glory as of the only Son from the Father, full of grace and truth.
nuance_note: Dwelt (Skienoo) originally means 'to pitch a tent', echoing God's presence in Exodus. 'Lived' has no theological significance.

phrase_cn: 你们要**常在**我里面
phrase_en: **Abide** in me
sentence_context: Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit by itself, unless it abides in the vine, neither can you, unless you abide in me.
nuance_note: Abide emphasizes continuous life connection (like a vine branch). 'Stay' is more like staying in a hotel.

phrase_cn: 这是耶稣所行的头一件神迹，是在加利利的迦拿行的，显出他的荣耀来；他的门徒就信了他。
phrase_en: This, the first of his signs, Jesus did at Cana in Galilee, and manifested his glory. And his disciples believed in him.
sentence_context: This, the first of his signs, Jesus did at Cana in Galilee, and manifested his glory. And his disciples believed in him.
nuance_note: A 'sign' (σημεῖον) is not just a miracle, but an act that points to a deeper spiritual truth about Jesus's identity and mission.

phrase_cn: 耶稣回答说：“我实实在在地告诉你，人若不重生，就不能见神的国。”
phrase_en: Jesus answered him, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless one is born again he cannot see the kingdom of God.”
sentence_context: Jesus answered him, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless one is born again he cannot see the kingdom of God.” Nicodemus said to him, “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother's womb and be born?”
nuance_note: 'Born again' (ἄνωθεν) carries the double meaning of 'born anew' and 'born from above,' emphasizing divine origin.

phrase_cn: 因为神差他的儿子降世，不是要定世人的罪，乃是要叫世人因他得救。
phrase_en: For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but in order that the world might be saved through him.
sentence_context: For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but in order that the world might be saved through him. Whoever believes in him is not condemned, but whoever does not believe is condemned already, because he has not believed in the name of the only Son of God.
nuance_note: The verb 'sent' (ἀπέστειλεν) highlights God's purposeful commission of Jesus for the specific mission of salvation.

phrase_cn: 这人来，是要作见证，就是为光作见证，叫众人因他可以信。
phrase_en: He came as a witness, to bear witness about the light, that all might believe through him.
sentence_context: He came as a witness, to bear witness about the light, that all might believe through him. He was not the light, but came to bear witness about the light.
nuance_note: To 'bear witness' (μαρτυρέω) implies a legal, authoritative testimony about truth, not just a casual observation.

phrase_cn: 吃我肉喝我血的人常在我里面，我也常在他里面。
phrase_en: Whoever feeds on my flesh and drinks my blood abides in me, and I in him.
sentence_context: Whoever feeds on my flesh and drinks my blood abides in me, and I in him. As the living Father sent me, and I live because of the Father, so whoever feeds on me, he also will live because of me.
nuance_note: 'Abides' (μένει) signifies a deep, continuous, and mutual indwelling, essential for spiritual life, not mere proximity.

phrase_cn: 耶稣说了这话，就举目望天说：“父啊，时候到了，愿你荣耀你的儿子，使儿子也荣耀你；
phrase_en: When Jesus had spoken these words, he lifted up his eyes to heaven, and said, “Father, the hour has come; glorify your Son that the Son may glorify you,”
sentence_context: When Jesus had spoken these words, he lifted up his eyes to heaven, and said, “Father, the hour has come; glorify your Son that the Son may glorify you, since you have given him authority over all flesh, to give eternal life to all whom you have given him.”
nuance_note: 'Glorify' (δοξάζω) means to reveal the inherent majesty, honor, and splendor of God/Christ, not just to laud.

phrase_cn: 耶稣对他说：“回去吧，你的儿子活了！”那人信耶稣所说的话就回去了。
phrase_en: Jesus said to him, “Go; your son will live.” The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him and went on his way.
sentence_context: Jesus said to him, “Go; your son will live.” The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him and went on his way. As he was going down, his servants met him and told him that his son was recovering.
nuance_note: Belief in Jesus's specific 'word' (ῥῆμα), rather than just a general idea, immediately results in a tangible outcome.

phrase_cn: 耶稣说：“我实实在在地告诉你们，你们若不吃人子的肉，不喝人子的血，就没有生命在你们里面。
phrase_en: So Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you have no life in you.”
sentence_context: So Jesus said to them, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you have no life in you. Whoever feeds on my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up on the last day.”
nuance_note: 'Flesh' (σάρξ) here emphasizes Jesus's humanity and sacrificial offering, which are spiritually consumed for eternal life.

phrase_cn: 但保惠师，就是父因我的名所要差来的圣灵，他要将一切的事指教你们，并且要叫你们想起我对你们所说的一切话。
phrase_en: But the Helper, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, he will teach you all things and bring to your remembrance all that I have said to you.
sentence_context: But the Helper, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, he will teach you all things and bring to your remembrance all that I have said to you. Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you. Not as the world gives do I give to you. Let not your hearts be troubled, neither let them be afraid.
key_term: send (差来), teach (指教), bring to remembrance (想起)
nuance_note: 'Helper' (Παράκλητος, Paraclete) denotes the Holy Spirit as an advocate, counselor, and comforter, not merely an assistant.

phrase_cn: 当耶稣在耶路撒冷过逾越节的时候，有许多人看见他所行的神迹，就信了他的名。
phrase_en: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the Passover Feast, many believed in his name when they saw the signs that he was doing.
sentence_context: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the Passover Feast, many believed in his name when they saw the signs that he was doing.
nuance_note: The term 'signs' (σημεῖα) in John points to a deeper spiritual reality and meaning, serving as evidence of Jesus's divine identity, not just a supernatural event.

phrase_cn: 耶稣回答说：“我实实在在地告诉你，人若不是从水和圣灵生的，就不能进神的国。
phrase_en: Jesus answered, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless one is born of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God.
sentence_context: Jesus answered, “Truly, truly, I say to you, unless one is born of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God.
nuance_note: To be 'born of the Spirit' (γεννηθῇ ἐκ πνεύματος) refers to a spiritual regeneration, a new birth from above, distinct from physical birth or mere human effort.

phrase_cn: 神爱世人，甚至将他的独生子赐给他们，叫一切信他的，不至灭亡，反得永生。
phrase_en: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
sentence_context: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
trap: None directly from list, but 'gave' could be weakened to 'give out'.
nuance_note: God's 'love' (ἀγαπάω) here is a sacrificial, active love, leading to the ultimate act of giving His Son, demonstrating immense divine initiative.

phrase_cn: 他不是那光，乃是要为光作见证。
phrase_en: He was not the light, but came to bear witness about the light.
sentence_context: He was not the light, but came to bear witness about the light.
trap: None specific from list, but 'bear witness' could be simplified to 'talk about'.
nuance_note: To 'bear witness' (μαρτυρέω) implies an authoritative and truthful testimony, establishing the identity and significance of Jesus as 'the light'.

phrase_cn: 耶稣回答说：“人子得荣耀的时候到了。
phrase_en: And Jesus answered them, “The hour has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.”
sentence_context: And Jesus answered them, “The hour has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.”
trap: None direct, but 'glorified' could be misconstrued as 'made famous'.
nuance_note: To 'be glorified' (δοξασθῇ) in this context refers to Christ's exaltation through his crucifixion, resurrection, and ascension, revealing his divine glory and redemptive purpose.

phrase_cn: 我是葡萄树，你们是枝子。常在我里面的，我也常在他里面，这人就多结果子；因为离了我，你们就不能做什么。
phrase_en: I am the vine; you are the branches. Whoever abides in me and I in him, he it is that bears much fruit, for apart from me you can do nothing.
sentence_context: I am the vine; you are the branches. Whoever abides in me and I in him, he it is that bears much fruit, for apart from me you can do nothing.
trap: None direct, but 'abide' could be weakly translated as 'stay' or 'live'.
nuance_note: To 'abide' (μένω) signifies a continuous, intimate, and dependent relationship with Christ, essential for spiritual fruitfulness and life.

phrase_cn: 我实实在在地告诉你们，那听我话、又信差我来者的，就有永生；不至于定罪，是已经出死入生了。
phrase_en: Truly, truly, I say to you, whoever hears my word and believes him who sent me has eternal life. He does not come into judgment, but has passed from death to life.
sentence_context: Truly, truly, I say to you, whoever hears my word and believes him who sent me has eternal life. He does not come into judgment, but has passed from death to life.
trap: None direct, but 'hears my word' could be weakened to merely 'listens'.
nuance_note: The act of 'believing' (πιστεύω) here is not merely intellectual assent but a profound trust and reliance on God, resulting in the present possession of eternal life and deliverance from judgment.

phrase_cn: 赐生命的乃是灵，肉体是无益的。我对你们所说的话就是灵，就是生命。
phrase_en: It is the Spirit who gives life; the flesh is no help at all. The words that I have spoken to you are spirit and life.
sentence_context: It is the Spirit who gives life; the flesh is no help at all. The words that I have spoken to you are spirit and life.
nuance_note: The 'words' (ῥήματα) of Jesus are not just human speech but carry divine, life-giving power through the Spirit, sharply contrasted with the impotence of 'flesh' (σάρξ).

phrase_cn: 那些来看马利亚的犹太人见了耶稣所做的事，就多有信他的。
phrase_en: Many of the Jews therefore, who had come with Mary and had seen what he did, believed in him.
sentence_context: Many of the Jews therefore, who had come with Mary and had seen what he did, believed in him.
nuance_note: The 'things he did' (ἃ ἐποίησεν) refer to Jesus's miraculous signs, particularly raising Lazarus, which served as powerful and convincing evidence, leading many to 'believe' (πιστεύω) in him.

phrase_cn: 凡接待他的，就是信他名的人，他就赐他们权柄，作神的儿女。
phrase_en: But to all who did receive him, who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God,
sentence_context: But to all who did receive him, who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God,
nuance_note: “信他名” (Xìn tā míng) implies placing trust and commitment in Jesus' person and authority, leading to adoption as children of God.

phrase_cn: 耶稣就对他说：“若不看见神迹奇事，你们总是不信。”
phrase_en: So Jesus said to him, “Unless you see signs and wonders, you will not believe.”
sentence_context: So Jesus said to him, “Unless you see signs and wonders, you will not believe.”
nuance_note: “神迹奇事” (Shénjì qíshì) are divine demonstrations of power meant to reveal truth and evoke faith, not mere 'magic tricks' or spectacles.

phrase_cn: 你们查考圣经，因你们以为内中有永生；给我作见证的就是这经。
phrase_en: You search the Scriptures because you think that in them you have eternal life; and it is they that bear witness about me,
sentence_context: You search the Scriptures because you think that in them you have eternal life; and it is they that bear witness about me,
nuance_note: “作见证” (Zuò jiànzhèng) highlights the prophetic role of the Scriptures in testifying about Christ as the source of eternal life.

phrase_cn: 耶稣说：“我就是生命的粮。到我这里来的，永不饥；信我的，永不渴。”
phrase_en: Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life; whoever comes to me shall not hunger, and whoever believes in me shall never thirst.”
sentence_context: Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life; whoever comes to me shall not hunger, and whoever believes in me shall never thirst.”
key_term: Believe (信) / Bread of Life (生命的粮)
nuance_note: “生命的粮” (Shēngmìng de liáng) is a metaphor for Jesus as the essential spiritual sustenance that satisfies and gives eternal life.

phrase_cn: 耶稣又对众人说：“我是世界的光。跟从我的，就不在黑暗里走，必要得着生命的光。”
phrase_en: Again Jesus spoke to them, saying, “I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will not walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.”
sentence_context: Again Jesus spoke to them, saying, “I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will not walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.”
nuance_note: “世界的光” (Shìjiè de guāng) proclaims Jesus as the ultimate source of spiritual and moral illumination, guiding humanity out of sin and ignorance.

phrase_cn: 盗贼来，无非是要偷窃、杀害、毁坏；我来了，是要叫羊得生命，并且得的更丰盛。
phrase_en: The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy. I came that they may have life and have it abundantly.
sentence_context: The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy. I came that they may have life and have it abundantly.
nuance_note: “丰盛的生命” (Fēngshèng de shēngmìng) describes the complete, rich, and eternal quality of life provided by Christ, contrasting with the thief's destructive intent.

phrase_cn: 耶稣对她说：“我就是复活和生命。信我的人，虽然死了，也要活着；凡活着信我的人，必永远不死。你信这话吗？”
phrase_en: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. Whoever believes in me, though he die, yet shall he live, and everyone who lives and believes in me shall never die. Do you believe this?”
sentence_context: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. Whoever believes in me, though he die, yet shall he live, and everyone who lives and believes in me shall never die. Do you believe this?”
nuance_note: “复活和生命” (Fùhuó hé shēngmìng) declares Jesus as the embodiment and source of victory over death and the giver of eternal existence.

phrase_cn: 耶稣说：“我就是道路、真理、生命。若不藉着我，没有人能到父那里去。”
phrase_en: Jesus said to him, “I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.”
sentence_context: Jesus said to him, “I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.”
key_term: Way (道路) / Truth (真理) / Life (生命)
nuance_note: “道路、真理、生命” (Dàolù, zhēnlǐ, shēngmìng) are not abstract principles but are personified in Jesus as the exclusive path, ultimate reality, and source of existence to the Father.

phrase_cn: 然而，我将真情告诉你们，我去是与你们有益的；我若不去，保惠师就不到你们这里来；我若去，就差他来。
phrase_en: Nevertheless, I tell you the truth: it is to your advantage that I go away, for if I do not go away, the Helper will not come to you. But if I go, I will send him to you.
sentence_context: Nevertheless, I tell you the truth: it is to your advantage that I go away, for if I do not go away, the Helper will not come to you. But if I go, I will send him to you.
nuance_note: “保惠师” (Bǎohuìshī, Paraclete) denotes the Holy Spirit as an active Advocate, Comforter, and Counselor, not a mere subordinate 'assistant'.

phrase_cn: 但记这些事，是要叫你们信耶稣是基督，是神的儿子，并且叫你们信了他，就可以因他的名得生命。
phrase_en: but these are written so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.
sentence_context: Now Jesus did many other signs in the presence of the disciples, which are not written in this book; but these are written so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.
nuance_note: The Greek term for 'signs' (σημεῖον), though not explicitly in v.31 but in the preceding v.30 and context, refers to Jesus' miraculous works. These are not just 'miracles' (奇迹) or 'magic' (魔术), but deliberate actions that point to (signify) his divine identity and purpose. The intended outcome is 'belief' (πίστις) in Jesus as the Christ, which leads to 'life' (ζωή).
